meanings.definition: To impress upon the mind by frequent repetition or persistent urging.
meanings.sent1: The teacher inculcates the importance of kindness by reminding us every day.
meanings.sent2: She inculcates good manners in her students through consistent reminders.
meanings.sent3: The parrot inculcates the phrase 'hello' by repeating it over and over.
meanings.sent4: Her storytelling inculcates a sense of wonder in the young listeners.
meanings.sent5: The coach inculcates the winning mindset in the team through motivational speeches.

meanings.definition: To teach and impress by frequent repetitions or admonitions.
meanings.sent1: The parent inculcates the value of honesty in their child through daily conversations.
meanings.sent2: He inculcates the importance of hard work by setting a good example.
meanings.sent3: The comedian inculcates laughter in the audience with his witty jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork inculcates a sense of peace and tranquility in the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The mentor inculcates valuable life lessons in the young minds through storytelling.
